input_text.Prompt: Can you tell me how to tweet using native sms services?
input_text.Response A: Sure! To tweet using native SMS services, you need to set up your phone to send and receive text messages from Twitter. To do this, go to your phone's settings and look for the option to add a new messaging account. From there, select Twitter as the messaging service and follow the instructions to set it up. Once it's set up, you can tweet by sending a text message to Twitter's short code (40404 in the US and Canada, and 646464 in the UK). Your tweet will be sent as a text message to your followers.
input_text.Response B:
To tweet using native SMS services, you need to have a mobile phone with internet connection and a Twitter account. Follow these steps:

1. Open your SMS app on your mobile phone.
2. Compose a new message and type a message in the format "Tweet text"
3. Send the SMS to the Twitter SMS number corresponding to your country.
4. The tweet will be posted to your Twitter account.

Note: You may need to register your mobile phone number with Twitter before you can use this feature.

input_meta.preamble_a: Respond authoritatively, assertively and persuasively, as if you are very knowledgeable about the topic.
input_meta.preamble_b: Respond authoritatively, assertively and persuasively, as if you are very knowledgeable about the topic.

label_annotations.feedback: I was unaware that you could do this via an sms, I also don’t understand why you would do this if you could just tweet anyway.
